page.title: 10WATER POWER
page.content: In the original Domesday Book,we find that a mill was recorded in {Hartlebury.}We went to see the mill. There was a very large wheel no longer in the water but standing on the grass.Scattered around were it's many parts.The{mills grinding}wheels were now used as steps,still showing the patterns and power.The water routes were still visable and the{pounds}were so clear that fish and eals were easily seen.{Wilden}too had its own mill,certain of the old villagers still talk about it but we can only see where it used to be.It is remembered for it's noise and size.It was stopped at night by diverting the water.Mutton fat was used to lubricate the wheel.
